title: Style visualizations to match SPSS software output

requirements.text: Update bar graph styling to match SPSS output aesthetics: use a clean, minimalist design with thin gridlines, standard gray axes, sans-serif labels, and muted default colors typical of statistical software output

quotes: The figures should be like they were generated from spss software

acceptanceCriteria: Bar graphs display with thin horizontal gridlines on white background
Axis labels use standard sans-serif font (Arial or similar)
Chart colors use SPSS-style palette (muted blues, greens, oranges)
Bars have minimal spacing and no shadows or gradients
Legend and labels match typical SPSS output formatting

requirements.text: Update table styling to match SPSS output aesthetics: use a simple grid layout with thin borders, monospace or sans-serif fonts for data cells, header row with subtle background, and precise alignment of numeric values

quotes: The figures should be like they were generated from spss software

acceptanceCriteria: Tables display with thin, consistent borders around all cells
Header row has subtle gray background distinguishing it from data rows
Numeric values are right-aligned and use consistent decimal places
Font matches SPSS output (typically Arial or Courier)
No rounded corners or decorative styling

constraints: Maintain the existing warm color palette in non-chart UI elements
Do not modify backend data structures or query functions
Keep all existing frontend routing and state management intact
nonGoals: Changing the research topic input form design
